tool.name: qiime2 diversity beta-phylogenetic

param.name: table
param.label: table: FeatureTable[Frequency | RelativeFrequency | PresenceAbsence]
param.help: [required] The feature table containing the samples over which beta diversity should be computed.

param.name: phylogeny
param.label: phylogeny: Phylogeny[Rooted]
param.help: [required] Phylogenetic tree containing tip identifiers that correspond to the feature identifiers in the table. This tree can contain tip ids that are not present in the table, but all feature ids in the table must be present in this tree.

param.name: metric
param.label: metric: Str % Choices('weighted_normalized_unifrac', 'generalized_unifrac', 'unweighted_unifrac', 'weighted_unifrac')
param.help: [required] The beta diversity metric to be computed.

param.name: __q2galaxy__GUI__select__
param.label: threads: Int % Range(1, None) | Str % Choices('auto')
param.help: [default: 1] The number of CPU threads to use in performing this calculation. May not exceed the number of available physical cores. If threads = 'auto', one thread will be created for each identified CPU core on the host.

param.name: threads
param.label: threads: Int % Range(1, None)
param.help: [default: 1] The number of CPU threads to use in performing this calculation. May not exceed the number of available physical cores. If threads = 'auto', one thread will be created for each identified CPU core on the host.

param.name: variance_adjusted
param.label: variance_adjusted: Bool
param.help: [default: No] Perform variance adjustment based on Chang et al. BMC Bioinformatics 2011. Weights distances based on the proportion of the relative abundance represented between the samples at a given node under evaluation.

param.name: alpha
param.label: alpha: Float % Range(0, 1, inclusive_end=True)
param.help: [optional] This parameter is only used when the choice of metric is generalized_unifrac. The value of alpha controls importance of sample proportions. 1.0 is weighted normalized UniFrac. 0.0 is close to unweighted UniFrac, but only if the sample proportions are dichotomized.

param.name: bypass_tips
param.label: bypass_tips: Bool
param.help: [default: No] In a bifurcating tree, the tips make up about 50% of the nodes in a tree. By ignoring them, specificity can be traded for reduced compute time. This has the effect of collapsing the phylogeny, and is analogous (in concept) to moving from 99% to 97% OTUs

tool.help:
QIIME 2: diversity beta-phylogenetic ==================================== Beta diversity (phylogenetic)
Outputs: -------- :distance_matrix.qza: The resulting distance matrix.
|
Description: ------------ Computes a user-specified phylogenetic beta diversity metric for all pairs of samples in a feature table.
|
